banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12

banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: How dance can unleash your inner joy

recItems.blurb: An example of using everyday gestures and situations to create choreography.
recItems.headline: "Learn Sia’s Chandelier Dance with Ryan Heffington"
recItems.label: WATCH

takeAction.blurb: Ryan Heffington leads pop-up dance classes in Los Angeles. Join his mailing list and discover upcoming classes and events.

nodes.whoTheyAre: Ryan Heffington is on a mission to get the world to dance.
nodes.whyListen:
A Grammy-nominated and Emmy-winning choreographer, Ryan Heffington has worked on everything from film to fashion, commercials to music videos. In March 2020, he became a north star of empowerment and self-expression for hundreds of thousands of people through his free, online dance class SweatFest. He believes everyone can access more happiness through dance.

Heffington pioneered contemporary dance in a commercial context in works including Sia's "Chandelier," HBO's Euphoria, Spike Jonze's commercials for Kenzo World and Apple's "Welcome Homepod," featuring FKA Twigs, Lin-Manuel Miranda’s film tick, tick...BOOM! and Netflix's The OA.

videoData.description: "We all have our own beautiful ways of moving, and this is worth celebrating," says dancer and choreographer Ryan Heffington. Inviting you to reconsider your connection to dance, he shows how even everyday experiences -- tying your shoes, rocking a baby, whisking up some mac and cheese -- can offer choreographic inspiration and help you find joy and release when you need it most. After the talk, dancers Nico Lonetree and Ryan Spencer perform a dazzling routine infused with the humor and beauty of daily movements.

Inviting you to reconsider your connection to dance, he shows how even everyday experiences -- tying your shoes, rocking a baby, whisking up some mac and cheese -- can offer choreographic inspiration and help you find joy and release when you need it most. After the talk, dancers Nico Lonetree and Ryan Spencer perform a dazzling routine infused with the humor and beauty of daily movements.

cues.text: What is your connection to dance?

or maybe you watch
those dance competitions on television?

Or did you jump into the hora
at that bar mitzvah one time?

I want you to reconsider
your connection to dance,

because I believe it to be
a simple and successful way
What do you need to participate?

but your will to explore
and have a little fun.

When I choreograph for film,
television and commercials,

I often generate moves
that are based on the human experience.

I take these moves,
I string them together,
twist and play with their pace,
in order to create more meaningful work.
Let me show you what I mean.

featuring the incredible dancer
Maddie Ziegler.

(Lyrics) Won’t open my eyes
Keep my glass full until morning light
Because I'm just holding on for tonight
Help me, I'm holding on for dear life
Won't look down, won't open my eyes
Keep my glass full until morning light
Because I'm just holding on for tonight

Ryan Heffington: Now, let's play
that video one more time.

And I want to show you
what inspired those moves.

You may be surprised
at how rudimentary the sources are.

RH: And fork, fork, fork,
stab it in the wall,

Charlie Chaplin, Charlie Chaplin,
cockroach up the wall,
Is it time for lunch yet?

See, even a cute little cockroach
can inspire a dance move.
But it really is that easy.
Most people can't dance like Maddie,

We all have our own
beautiful ways of moving,

It’s time to extract the judgment
out of our dance experience

and set free the preconceived notion
of what "good" dance is.
find out how your own body loves to move,
and find out that inner rhythm

So you may ask, "Well, how do I access
or unlock this dance magic?"

Well, once you have the perspective
that life is dance,

You'll begin to see dance
everywhere around you, all day long,
Witness how you're sitting in front of me.
Is one leg crossed over the other?
So check out this proof of concept.

In the first week of the worldwide
lockdown in March 2020,

I decided to teach this online
follow-along dance class called SWEATFEST.

I was hoping that a couple
of friends would join in,

but over the course
of the next couple of weeks,

tens of thousands of people
from all over the world
and really unleashed that joy from within,
while the world was in disarray.

Who would have guessed
that moves like the Pretty Pony

So, I've been a student
of dance for 42 years.

My relationship with the art form
runs deep and quite intimate.

but most of all, it's been
an unfaltering joy in my life.

Because I believe
there's more joy for you,

So, I'd love to invite you
to be your own choreographer.
Grab your kids or go solo,

and let fun and laughter push
the boundaries of ridiculousness.
or whisking up mac and cheese
will become your new favorite dance move.

And once you have a dance move
or two or three or four under your belt,

and share those moves and that happiness
with those around you,
because a world of more dance
is a world of more joy.

If you feel good
about yourself and the world,
it will show in your painting,
and all these little things will happen.
